column4: breaking news!! the iso image IS NOT optimized for flash media!!
if you use unetbootin, it's fairly obvious
irssi usually runs on an OS
as said already, unetbootin can give you a small persistent storage area
all you actually need to do is install to the USB disk, Linux doesn't really care where you install it to
to Linux a usb drive is the same as any other drive, if you want to you can do an ordinary install to one
if you want a _live OS_ with some extra persistent storage, use unetbootin, etc.
that isn't a fragmentation issue, but a partition issue
gparted/parted can fix that if you need to resize; if you only need to make a new partition table, try cfdisk
